title: Pull request twitter pic
body:
The profile picture pulled from twitter with `profile_image_url_https` will have `_normal.png` attached to the end of the url. According to the [Twitter Docs](https://dev.twitter.com/overview/general/user-profile-images-and-banners), normal = 48x48px (too small for the new bio pages).

I removed the last 11 characters ('_normal.png') and then added the `.png` back. I'm sure there is more elegant way to do it.

title: Angularize login

title: Edit wording of jquery exercises
body:
Removed 'the' from some of the questions for consistency. The rule applied: either use "the <target> element" or only "<target>" when not following with "element." Alternatively, instead of removing "the," you could instead add "element" to the end of each reference to a target. But as it was, the wording was inconsistent.

Also removed extra "from."

title: Adding testing feature to bonfire
body:
I have created an addition to the bonfire IDE that allows users to test any function within the main coding window.  Here are some pieces of its functionality:
- Identifies arguments and creates input boxes for each
- Side by side mode with editor
- Test suite execution displays percentage of tests correct, highlights passing tests green, failing tests red
- For failing tests, displays what the actual output was
- Users can delete tests once they are created

Here are some todos that still remain:
- Don't use the eval method to evaluate the test. Nate has the plugin, but it is currently only configured with the console output.  I need to make the test framework work as a callback from the plugin completing its execution.  This requires changing a large portion of Nate's code, so I held off on it.
- Allow other types of comparisons besides equality.  We can test behavior, type, length, features of a JSON object, almost anything with chai.

title: Added a title to bonfire for seo
body: Learn to code is our focus keyword for seo, so I added a title :)

title: Changed Challenge Complete Tweet Auto Text: Fix for #49
body:
**Change 1:**
I added the FreeCodeCamp Twitter username as well as the "Related" parameter to the auto tweet text.

This changes the tweet text from:

I just NUKED Free Code Camp Challenge #6: Use jQuery for Styling http://freecodecamp.com/challenges/12  #learntocode #javascript

to:

I just NUKED @FreeCodeCamp Challenge #6: Use jQuery for Styling http://freecodecamp.com/challenges/12 #learntocode #javascript

---

**Change 2:**
Also added the "Related accounts" parameter as per https://dev.twitter.com/web/intents

Which gives Tweet poster an opportunity by Twitter to follow the FreeCodeCamp Twitter account if they haven't done so already done so. Poster's that already follow the FCC account will not see this option.

---

**To test:**
Unfollow FCC on Twitter, 
complete a challenge ,
Tweet about challenge completion

Expected result:
1) FreeCodeCamp Username in tweet
2) After tweeting opportunity to follow FCC account

title: Use should.eql to compare arrays
body: When trying to pass the  "Return Largest Numbers in Arrays" challenge, I seem to be unable to pass the provided tests. I'm not familiar with Chai, but it would seem that we need to switch to .eql rather than === or should.equal when comparing two arrays to deeply compare the values rather than comparing objects.

title: Update bonfires.json with two new challenges
body:
Diff Two Arrays: Compare two arrays and return a new array with any items not found in both of the original arrays.

Word Search Puzzle: Write a function that accepts a randomized 8 x 7 capital letter grid in the form of a string with line breaks and one space between each letter column as the first argument and a 3 to 7 letter string as the second argument. The second argument is hidden in horizontal, vertical, or diagonal view somewhere within the grid. Your job is to return the coordinates (Row, Column) of the second argument in an array.

title: Add Cash Register Challenge
body: Design a cash register drawer function that accepts purchase price as the first argument, payment as the second argument, and cash-in-drawer (cid) as the third argument. cid is a 2d array listing available currency. Return the string "Insufficient Funds" if change due is less than the cash-in-drawer. Return the string "Closed" if cash-in-drawer is equal to the change due. Otherwise, return change in coin and bills, sorted in highest to lowest order.

I copied the user.challengesHash setting to mirror the challenges since I didn't want to mess with code that was already being used. So whenever you add a new Challenge in the future you will need to add the same to challengesCompleted.

title: On story submission create unique story URL if slug already exists
body:
#283

Also changed Story.find to Story.findOne because if you clicked on a link like "/stories/google" and there was a "/stories/google-1" in the database Story.find would return both and end up sending the user to "/stories/google" then "/stories/google-1". The user would just see "/stories/google-1" since it happens so fast but you can see it in the cli.

Since only 1 result should be returned anyway (`exports.returnIndividualStory`), I figured using findOne would be appropriate.

Quick question: What Is the reason for find using regex on the Story.find?:
 `Story.find({'storyLink' : new RegExp(storyName, 'i')}, function(err, story) {`

title: On story submission create unique story URL if slug already exists FIX
having the text for showing streak should be fine.
body:
Nothing can fix the heatmap graphic. I tried setting HTML attributes:

> **Notes**
> When [_Element_.setAttribute() is] called on an HTML element in an HTML document, setAttribute lower-cases its attribute name argument.

[MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/setAttribute)

However I think just having the streaks visible should be ok. No harm in that.

title: Issue #277 Fix- coursewares chai-jquery test issue
body:
Should address #277 : The tests were not catching correct color attrs for the CSS challenges.

Going forward - reason seems to be that jquery's .css() returns the _computed_ value for colors - i.e. it's running the tests using rgb(255, 0, 0) instead of "red" or hex values. It's also very picky and does want the spaces after the commas - rgb(255,0,0) does not work. (The docs used to say that you can use strings/hex; they have since been corrected.)

http://api.jquery.com/css/#css1

I also changed another test that was looking for "monospace" as the font degradation, but the instructions said to use "Serif." (Specify how fonts should degrade)

I tested them on my computer and they seemed to work just fine.

This was done with the help of @aldraco Either of us can be contacted with questions or for an explanation.

title: Several UX fixes and a www redirect bug fix
Site speed
body:
I've refactored the resources.js controller to respond faster by caching the results of most of the utility functions that get id and name info for our content. 

Controllers have been refactored to separate the return from mongo from the data used further down in the functions. 

The sitemap function in resources has been heavily refactored. Returning all users from the database is a massive network request and was blocking the server. The async.js library has been used in favor of repeatedly nested callbacks to make things easier to read.

The privacy route has been restored and permanently redirects to the correct field-guide.

Minor format changes in code for readability as well as linting cleanup to unify style.

Update Make a Person bonfire for more detailed instructions, closes #336

title: slight tidy and example

title: Fixes #352 - Camper News email notification
body:
The logic behind the Camper News email notifications now fits these requirements:

> - As a person who posted the story, I want to receive a notification when someone comments on it.
> - As a person who comments on a story, I want to receive a notification if someone replies to my comment.
> - As a person receiving such a notification email, I can see who commented and click a link to go directly to the story.

title: Usability improvements and courseware/field-guide copy improvements
Twitter API endpoint for Zipline/Codepen
body:
New Dependencies:
- twitter application TWITTER_TOKEN and TWITTER_TOKEN_SECRET should be added to .env.

Usage:
Campers can make a simple $.ajax call to freecodecamp.com/api/codepen/twitter/:screenName and a JSON with the ten most recent tweets from either :screenName or FreeCodeCamp will be returned. No XSS issues w/ codepen.

I also added room for other API calls for similar usage in codepen - twitch, slack, and possibly a tweet stream - which I can add later if approved, or remove if not.

Thanks!

title: Cleaner output form 'Turn an Image into a Link'
body:
Seems like using expect() to validate code is clutters up the success message.
![fcc-to be](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3090888/7895029/8226231e-0679-11e5-9772-4ac27765c877.png)

After a cursory glance, this was the only similar occurrence in any of the HTML/CSS Waypoints. Changing expect statemtens to assert statments in the bonfires just seemed to mess up the entire thing, and I've found them helpful, so I assume they shouldn't be replaced all over?
What is the general "policy" towards assert vs expect? Seems to be a somewhat even split between the two.

title: Changed input type from checkbox to radio and attribute comparison name from trait to personality
body:
Issue below:

> Challenge http://www.freecodecamp.com/challenges/waypoint-create-a-set-of-checkboxes has an >issue. Please describe how to reproduce it, and include links to screen shots if possible.
> 
> Give your radio buttons the name attribute of "personality".
> 
> Cannot satisfy this request. This waypoint is on checkboxes and it is asking for me to edit the radio >button. I've changed the checkboxes and the radio buttons to have name="personality" nothing works.

The problem seems to be in the test. If you add the name trait to a checkbox then the challenge will pass. So to fix this I just changed the input type from a checkbox to a radio (which is what the instructions tell you to do it on) and I changed the attribute comparison from trait to personality (which is what the instructions tell you to name it).

I've tested this with console.log and my update works for me. Please review and let me know.

Thanks,
Charles

body:
Makes the test case look for the case-insensitive "http://catphotoapp.com" instead of just "com" in the anchor's href attribute. I chose to use the global, case-insensitive regex instead of just `$('a').attr('href') === 'http://catphotoapp.com'` because it gives the user a bit more freedom (see trailing backslashes etc.) and I've seen it used in other test cases. Let me know if you want a stricter or looser test and I'll change it.

Fixes #914.

title: Test for almost palindromes in 'Check for Palindromes'
body:
Adds a test for strings that start and end in the same characters but that are not complete palindromes.
Fixes #911

title: Check fix in 'Bootstrap Grid'.
body:
The previous test case forgot to check that the relevant element actually existed, causing it to always be true.
Fixes #907

title: Added auto-saving feature for Bonfires
body:
to version 0.0.6

Added auto save(to local storage) for any progress made in editor. It will set the IDE text to whatever the user last saw within 24 hours when page has been loaded. 
The auto save happens every 1.5 seconds _after_ someone lifts a key.

title: Added Reset Modal for auto-save feature
body: When the reset button has been pressed this modal will popup asking for confirmation.

title: Added Reset Button Underneath Run
body: This will now display a danger button showing "Reset" for anyone who wants to start over from the original server sent code.

title: KrisVos130 NL Translation - Section 1
body: Translated the first section, get-set-for-free-code-camp.json, into Dutch. Since Slack had a maximum of 10.000 messages, I can't go back to see if I need to send a pull request when I have translated everything, or just a section.

Fixed minor grammatical mistake - changed "Your app should have an text field input element" to "Your app should have a text field input element"

closes #1006 
closes #1036

title: Add video link to Symmetric Differences Bonfire
body: The challenge can be quite difficult if you don't fully understand what a Symmetric Difference actually is.  The Wikipedia page is . . . not enlightening.  There is a very nice YouTube video which was very helpful to me.

title: Fixes misspelling that caused 'undefined is not function' error
body: `unDasherize` was assigned an undefined variable, causing 500 TypeErrors when trying to call it on `origChallengeName` at line 194 in `server/boot/challenge.js`, effectively rendering all challenges inaccessible.

title: Some "Slack to Gitter" edits
body:
Don't pull this yet. I split this up into two commits to make it easier to discuss. I was pretty much 100% about the edits in 77d4aff; I went ahead and changed 'in' to 'on' because it sounded better in my head and people in the chat seemed to agree.

In f8fa6ee I just added Gitter as an alternative to Slack because Gitter works closely with GitHub and I wasn't sure whether the non-profits use GitHub or not.

Since my Spanish is not what it should be, I only replaced the links, leaving a native Spanish speaker to reword the sentences in `seed/challenges/get-set-for-free-code-camp.json`.

Lastly, I found a JSON key on line 129 in `common/models/user.json` called `sentSlackInvite`. I'm not sure what this does, couldn't find a reference anywhere else, so I didn't dare to remove it.

Before (and if) you pull this I'd like to rebase it into a single commit, and, if someone explains the Spanish and `sentSlackInvite` parts, add those changes.

title: Issue 1094 - Field Guide Error
body:
"Contact Jason Ruekert - he's @jsonify in Slack."

Since freecodecamp is now using Gitter again, changed it to say "Contact Jason Ruekert - he's @jsonify in Gitter."

title: Issue 1080
body: Changed "Twitter Bootstrap" to "Bootstrap". It used to be it's name but it's not any more. It's in their brand guidelines to not refer to it as Twitter Bootstrap any more: http://getbootstrap.com/about/#name

This closes #1059

"Your pair will have their own cursor, and will be able to type text on his or her and keyboard."

Removed the "and" after "his or her".

This closes #923

title: Tidying the stylesheets
body:
...and some related stuff.

I'm not even sure what I was doing anymore, but I stumbled upon an unused CSS selector, decided to look for more, and found quite a few. I'm honsetly not sure if these are somehow used through some sort of magic, but I searched through the entire codebase and found no other references to them, so they should be safe to remove.

Other than remove unused selectors, I organized some of them, fixed the stylization of a few, replaced one, as well as replaced the ubiqitous `#eee` with the already existing `@gray-lighter` variable.

This should hopefully clear the CSS/LESS up a bit, but don't just trust me, get in there and read (specifically the `next-challenge-button` and `delay-half` parts, they confused me) ; I did my best to make sure I'm not deleting some classes, essential to FCC's design, but I'm not making any promises.

title: Change Height on Footer element in Bonfire View
body:
Refer to line 677. Proposing removal of Padding increase on footer links in bonfire view as it causes the page content to exceed viewport height and creates a scrollbar. This issue currently effects all bonfire views. In response to issue #1247 

closes #1247

...and makes them do this instead:
![fcc-post](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3090888/8627095/0f24d4f0-2749-11e5-9e64-02963e197cce.png)

title: 'Create a Text Field' now makes sure the input type is text.
body:
Instead of just checking if there's an `input` tag, the test now checks for an `input` tag with the `type` attribute set to `text`.

Fixes #1241.

title: Profile pictures in 'Camper News' now link to profiles.
body:
A minor typo in some Jade files caused profile pictures in 'Camper News' to lead to the homepage instead of the profiles belonging to the news posters. If I found all the typos, this should no longer be a problem.

Fixes #1235
